thread.title: Jeff Sessions Joins Tucker to Defend Himself Against Dems’ Russia Attacks
thread.title_full: Jeff Sessions Joins Tucker to Defend Himself Against Dems’ Russia Attacks

author: V Saxena
title: Jeff Sessions Joins Tucker to Defend Himself Against Dems’ Russia Attacks
text:
WATCH: Trump Supporter Spars With MSNBC Host Over AG Sessions and Russia 
“And he raised that question with me, and my answer went straight to that,” he added. 
By “that question,” he meant Franken asking him how exactly he would proceed if evidence were uncovered showing that Trump’s associates had indeed been communicating with the Russian government in the course of the presidential campaign as part of their surrogate duties, as noted by Legal Insurrection . 
“I”m not aware of any of those activities,” Sessions had replied. “I have been called a surrogate at a time or two in that campaign, and I did not have communications with the Russians.” Advertisement - story continues below 
Watch the full interview below: 
Sessions’ otherwise benign confirmation-hearing reply suddenly became the center of all political attention earlier this week after The Washington Post published a report claiming that Sessions had spoke with Russian diplomat Sergey Kislyak, who has served as his nation’s ambassador to the U.S. since 2008, at least twice last year — once in July and once in September. 
What the fake news outlet had neglected to mention was that these meetings had been spurred by Sessions’ status as a senator and a member of the Armed Services Committee, and this was the point Sessions tried to get across to Carlson. Advertisement - story continues below
